com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.display

Class BitmapData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.ProxyObject
      • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.display.BitmapData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBitmapDrawable

    public class BitmapData
extends ProxyObject
implements IBitmapDrawable
    The BitmapData class lets you work with the data (pixels) of a Bitmap object . You can use the methods of the BitmapData class to create arbitrarily sized transparent or opaque bitmap images and manipulate them in various ways at runtime. You can also access the BitmapData for a bitmap image that you load with the flash.display.Loader class. peer class lets you separate bitmap rendering operations from the internal display updating routines of FlashDetect Player. By manipulating a BitmapData object directly, you can create complex images without incurring the per-frame overhead of constantly redrawing the content from vector data.

    The methods of the BitmapData class support effects that are not available through the filters available to non-bitmap display objects.

    A BitmapData object contains an array of pixel data. peer data can represent either a fully opaque bitmap or a transparent bitmap that contains alpha channel data. Either type of BitmapData object is stored as a buffer of 32-bit integers. Each 32-bit integer determines the properties of a single pixel in the bitmap.

    Each 32-bit integer is a combination of four 8-bit channel values (from 0 to 255) that describe the alpha transparency and the red, green, and blue (ARGB) values of the pixel. (For ARGB values, the most significant byte represents the alpha channel value, followed by red, green, and blue.)

        channelOptions - the channel options
        grayScale - the gray scale
